title: What will be the fallout of ethnic violence in India’s Manipur?
description: Video of two tribal women being assaulted has caused outrage with questions for the governing BJP.

title: The international community must stand up to Myanmar’s junta
description: We must show the same resolve as all those fighting for democracy in Myanmar.

title: Spain heads for the polls as far right poised to make gains
description: Final opinion polls tip right-wing Popular Party to win most seats, but without securing working parliamentary majority.

title: Sudan civilians reportedly killed in Darfur fighting
description: The fighting between army and the paramilitary forces in Darfur region prompts thousands to flee into neighbouring Chad.

title: Greece faces hottest July in 50 years as heatwave sweeps Europe
description: Meteorologists warned of temperatures soaring above 40C (104F), as southern Europe is swept by blistering heatwave.

title: India: Tribal groups protests against Manipur mob sexual assaults
description: Thousands of demonstrators demand arrest of those involved in sexual assaults on two women that caused an outcry.

title: Palestinians call for probe into Israeli killing of teenager
description: Fawn Makhalfeh, 18, was killed by Israeli forces in what Palestinian foreign ministry denounced as an 'execution'.

title: Russian journalist killed, three wounded near Ukraine front line
description: Defence ministry says they were evacuated from the battlefield, but RIA's Rostislav Zhuravlev died during the journey.

description: Parliament is set to begin voting on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's proposed changes to the judicial system.

title: Ukraine attacked Russian village with cluster munitions: Governor
description: Governor of Russia's Belgorod region says no casualties reported in the village of Zhuravlevka near the Ukraine border.

title: From marathon glory to jail: Nigeria’s ‘great race fiasco’
description: A new book abut marathon champion Gideon Hagack tells a strange and little-known story of sporting injustice.

title: Hundreds attempt to storm Baghdad’s Green Zone over Quran burning
description: Protesters gather after reports that the far-right Danish group Danske Patrioter burned the Quran in Copenhagen.

description: US film and TV actors and writers unite in historic double strike against studios and streaming giants.

title: Argentina superstar Lionel Messi nets winner in Inter Miami debut
description: Miami went on to defeat Mexican side Cruz Azul 2-1 after Messi's free-kick goal in the last minutes game.

title: Desiree Ellis: How a trailblazing coach lifted S African football
description: Once sacked from her day job after playing for South Africa, she’s now leading Banyana Banyana at the Women's World Cup.

description: World-leading dementia scientists discuss the controversies surrounding new Alzheimer’s medications.

description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 514th day.

title: As temperatures rise, what’s the cost to the global economy?
description: As millions in the Northern Hemisphere grapple with extreme heat, we look at the cost of the latest climate threats.

title: US commissions navy warship USS Canberra in Sydney
description: Warship latest collaboration between the two countries as they join forces to combat China's influence in the Pacific.

title: Pop band The 1975’s set stopped in Malaysia after onstage kiss
description: Good Vibes festival organisers said 1975's set was stopped due to 'non-compliance with local performance guidelines'.

title: Metgharabiin: Ramy Essam’s story of exile told through his music
description: Essam's new album Metgharabiin (Outsiders) captures the struggles of Egypt's activists, in prison, exile or silenced.

description: Latest North Korean missile launches come amid warnings as US nuclear-armed submarine docks in South Korea port.

title: Can Manipur ever trust India again?
description: The Indian State's inaction in Manipur is its latest betrayal of the country's northeast. Long silences speak volumes.

title: ‘Why would I vote?’:Cambodians quietly question election’s value
description: Some plan to resist a discredited national election the only way they can: by staying at home on voting day.

title: Cambodia’s sham election might be Hun Sen’s last
description: Asia's longest serving leader makes his own rules, in golf and politics. Now he's preparing his sons to take over.
